content.question: Betty was just diagnosed with multiple sclerosis. Which of the following effects is she most likely to experience?

choices.label: The neurons in her body will not be able to reach threshold, leading to fatigue.
Depolarization in her neurons will not occur, causing sensory impairment.
Neurotransmitters will remain in the synapse for an extended period, causing memory loss.
Neural messages will travel slowly down the axon, leading to motor impairment.

content.answer: Neural messages will travel slowly down the axon, leading to motor impairment.
